title: Efficient vaccination
body:
Came today to have my COVID vaccination.
Everything went very efficiently and everyone was very helpful and friendly

title: Competent efficiency
body: My Chinese Covid Jab appointment went really well - staff and volunteers were great. I arrived ahead of my appointment, and was done and left as My appointed time approached!

title: Excellent communication
body: Today we took part in an online meeting with the surgeries to discuss, amongst other things, the corona vaccination rollout. The information given was clear concise and informative. Information was also given as to how other GP services were being managed at this difficult time. We were given information about other agencies who were offering help with issues that have arisen due to the pandemic. ie, mental health services. The staff were friendly, articulate and answered questions in a concise and professional manner. I had my vaccine last week and cannot praise the organisation highly enough. Well done Stourport Medical Centre and staff.You are giving a fantastic service at this time.

title: Helpful staff and Drs
body:
I needed support post covid and the practice staff and gps were so thoughtful and kind to me whilst I was recovering. 
I can’t thank them enough

title: COVID-19 Vaccination
body: I had my first vaccination today. The process was extremely well organised and everyone involved was efficient and cheerful. Many thanks to all of you.

title: Really helpful
body:
Despite being in the middle of a pandemic I have always been able to speak to a GP or get an appointment.
Everyone I have spoken to has helpful and I felt as though they listened and didn't feel rushed. 
The reception team were very welcoming

title: Great practice
body: So impressed with all the COVID vaccinations updates. Lots of info on Facebook and even a zoom COVID-19 info session

title: Amazing staff
body: I went to Victoria road medical centre today for my covid vaccination. The team at this practice is very helpful. I didn’t have to wait to long for my jab. The doctor who administered the jab was very good and also were the admin team. I’ve never had a problem with this practice I have been registered with this practice for 27 years. Great staff ! great work! Keep the good work going you guys are amazing.

title: Fantastic practice
body:
Efficient, reassuring, caring, cannot fault any of the staff. They go above and beyond!

Huge Thank you!!!

title: Unbelievably efficient and well-organised
body:
I went for my Covid jab today, and was amazingly impressed at how well-organised the whole process was. I was notified to attend via a text to my mobile phone - and followed it up with a call. I was booked in and turned up 10 minutes early.

Initially, I was a bit shocked at the length of the queue to get in, but on joining the queue it moved quickly. While standing in line, someone from the surgery came round and checked our details using a mobile device- thus saving time when we got in. As I got to the entrance, there was someone there with a form that was mostly pre-completed - and he then ran me through the questions that only I could answer.

I went inside, and was asked directed in a very orderly way to line up and go into a room to get vaccinated - after which I was directed to wait to see if there were any side-effects, before going out of a separate exit door.

It was run as efficiently as a car production line, but with human, friendly faces. I could not have asked for a better, more efficient experience.

title: COVID Vaccination
body: Very efficient service. All the staff were polite and helpful. The doctor and administrator explained everything clearly and made the whole experience pleasant.

title: Coronavirus vaccination experience
body: Impressed with the efficiency of the vaccination operation and how they got large numbers of people through.  However in my (uninformed) opinion I do wonder about the suitability of this location for giving out the Pfizer vaccination - as some of the post vaccination observation areas appeared to have poor social distancing eg: in places people only sitting one seat apart.

title: Not good will sadly be leaving the practice
body: Mostly rude reception staff, diagnose you over the phone and leave you in pain.  Have waited previously 1hr and 15 minutes for somebody to answer phone.  Impossible to see a doctor even with negative COVID test!

title: Disgusting
body: Trying to get through to this surgery is like looking for diamonds in the garden. Tried this morning at 10.05 all the messages are about the virus, I only wanted advice on medication of my hubbys diabetes. I endeed up ringing Queensbury medical centre got through straight away, after speaking to someone there was advised to ring 111 for advice. Finally got through to someone who told me to ring Cowgill Surgery again and got through. Waiting now for doctor to ring back. As Cowgill surgery still got no doctors that work there anymore, its run by Affinity Care and to be honest service is diabolical.

title: Unprofessional and felt that I did not matter.
body: I had a telephone appointment with a staff member at 9am via my home phone. At 10am . nobody called. On the fourth attempt, someone answered the phone at reception and said that I had been booked in for 9am. When staff called to provide me with my consultation, they said that they were an hour late in calling because they had been discussing a case with a colleague. No answer was given when I asked them why nobody had bothered to call me to say that they would be delayed but that my appointment was still running. To omit to call anyone, let alone a mentally ill person to say that you are going to be delayed is not only the height of bad manners it is also highly unprofessional. I have been left with the opinion that this careless attitude gives me the impression that they thought that it was okay to leave me hanging as I don't matter and that I am just an NHS number that doesn't matter until something awful happens to me. Absolutely disgusted and I am still very distressed about this. I have a good mind to submit a formal complaint.

readBy.name: Birmingham and Solihull Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fabulous nurse
body:
Might be a bit of an odd thing to celebrate - I had the best ever experience of having a smear test today. I wish I could recall her name (it was 9am appointment on 19/02).  
Normally hate them & have often put them off for long periods of time.  Never again.  She was just brilliant.   Thank you.

title: Incompetent
body:
For many years the Service provided has been in decline. Since Covid, it has been abhorrent. Whenever you ring, you are subjected to twenty questions from the arrogant receptionist, and if they condescendingly (begrudgingly even) think you warrant assistance, you might be granted an audience with a GP ... but frequently you are robbed off to an external provider because the gps cannot be bothered. 

Once you are lucky enough to obtain an appointment, albeit a telephone conversation, frequent mistakes are made. Prescriptions are assured but then forgotten to be written, leaving patients in agony for days. Blood tests are taken but no results shared ... until months later when a nurse rings, apologetically, to advise you might have type 2 diabetes.

title: Awful service
body: Awful to get through to, once get through can only get phone call appointment, (Covid-19) Don’t call back at time said left for 3 hours very poorly advised by 111 to call doctors. Such poor service. Dealing with cancer patient, not seem to be concerned at all. Awful doctors

title: Lucky to have such a good surgery
body: Despite the problems Covid has created everyone from receptionist to GP were excellent no complaints at all.

title: telephone answering service
body: Phoned today at 09.20 no 8 in queue answered 09.38, spoke for about 2 mins, and informed triage nurse would phone back. She duly phoned back after about 15 mins. and clarified the queries and concerns I had over new medication to be injected as against oral medication it was to replace. Yesterday afternoon, after receiving my new medication, I fully read the accompanying leaflet , over 3 x A4 sheets, and needed queries, I had regarding the new medication, answering. I tried to get through twice before eventually getting through on the third attempt at 17.55. no. 9 in queue, got down to no. 1 in queue and was disconnected at 18.22. redialled at 18.23 was n0. 6 in queue, got down to no.2 at 18.31 and was cut off again. Redialled at 18.32 and recording said you were closed. Not very happy as I would have liked an answer yesterday. and was awake until after 03.00 hrs this morning.

title: Covid Vaccine
body: Went to Whitley House for a covid vaccine and the whole process was wonderfully efficient and everyone was so friendly.

title: Hard work
body:
It's hit or miss with this surgery. I often find myself in a position of receiving either good care and respect from Doctors, or finding myself practically crying after I have spoken to the Doctors. 
There is no consistency in treatment, I get advice from one Doctor and find myself back at square one with another Doctor.
Furthermore, the way in which I am spoken to is horrible. When I call the surgery, I am nervous about the appointment because I feel like I have to justify why I am calling and practically asking them to speak to me like a human being. 
I am calling because I am sick, and whilst the Doctors have their reasons for the things they can or can't do, I do not expect to be spoken to like a child and have this result in feeling I've been condescended to. It is seriously unprofessional.
I'm sorry things are incredibly busy at the moment, and I appreciate the reasons for this. It is not that I want to call you or take your time away from others - I have to ring because of existing conditions. It would be helpful for you to approach your patients with a bit of empathy and compassion - not that they're being a nuisance.

title: Very disappointing
body: Have been trying to get through on the telephone for three days, on one of the days I rang up 129 times, how's it possible for the phone to be constantly engaged? I had to physically go to the surgery even though I am recovering from 15+ surgeries since the beginning of December and I am still recovering this is shocking service the staff are also rude and abrupt and act like you are an inconvenience I shall be moving surgeries as soon as possible!

title: Forever waiting
body:
Pre-covid and Post-covid this surgery is a nightmare to book into. This really has been the same for years pre-covid, so they don't have that excuse. 
I have the absolute full respect of the doctors and nurse staff for their rolls in the health service i really do, this is purely the practice functionality that is absolutely shocking and slow. 

Phone rings and rings, no answer. Everytime i need an appointment (very very rarely in the 10+ years on their books) its always a hassle getting through. 
They claim the respond to 100% appointments being made.. yes.. if they answer your call. 

Car park is small and very tight to maneuver. The NHS app is locked off for so many functions for this particular practice.
Big update needed.

title: Difficult times
body: Its taken me over two weeks to get through to the PALs team and the only way I did was telephone the secretary of the hospital director ( very helpful lady) and she got the PALs team to telephone me back within an hour and she also was a very helpful lady. Its a shame in these trouble times the hospital director doesn't give the PALs team the help and support dealing with a large hospital deserves. One lady department for a hospital of this size in these difficult times. Now Rivers hospital had given me the PAH pals team number but it turns out it isn't makes you wonder if Rivers was just hoping I would go away or get covid ?. A poorly run hospital Rivers is from the theatre nurses down to the people who answer the telephone for NHS patients,

title: Great organisation
body: Just had first covid vaccine injection and 10 out of 10 for the staff and organisation of the whole set up.

title: Saved my Dad's life
body: My dad called for advice, thinking he could stay home when he was seriously ill with Covid. If it was not for the receptionist realising he needed help quickly and putting him through to the GP who immediately recognised he needed help and fast as he was unable to breathe I would not have my Dad here today. I am so full of gratitude for the quick actions of the staff at this surgery. I cannot thank them enough for, along with the staff at Warwick giving me plenty more years with my dad

title: Excellent service
body:
Received Covid jab today, excellent service throughout, only took 5 minutes from arriving to receiving jab. Very thorough job carried out by all involved,
.

title: Visual Imaging Unit
body: Attendance at VIU for Procedure on 18/2/21 went smoothly with a satisfactory outcome.  All staff were friendly, considerate and efficient.  Coronavirus precations were clearly being observed.  Nothing to complain about whatsoever.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic experience
body: Firstly when attending for the Covid Vaccination we were met and greeted by smiling faces and directed quickly and efficiently to where we needed to be.  Within a minute or so we were in a room with two smiling nurses, injections done and then guided to the waiting room where we were asked to wait for 15 mins.  During that time the meet and greet people kept checking that we were all feeling well and even told a couple of jokes creating a great atmosphere and the time just flew.   A couple of days later I had an issue requiring some medication and was referred to the Practice by the Chemists in Royton.  I spoke to the receptionist and explained the situation she was so kind showing sympathy and dealing with the situation immediately.  After supplying a required sample she told me I would receive a call shortly.  I drove straight home and as I walked through the front door the phone rang.  I spoke to the Practice Nurse and following that conversation I was able to collect the prescribed medication within 2.5 hours of visiting the surgery.  What a fantastic service from all the staff. I have occasion to visit the District Nurses at the Practice on a weekly basis with my Him Indoors.  The reception staff there and the District Nurses always look after us wearing a smile and with kindness.

title: Great Doctors, mostly poor admin/office staff/ANP…
body:
Would personally recommend the doctors I have dealt with at the surgery which is why I stay having a complex medical history for family member.  However having to deal with the practice manager, some of the reception staff and ANPs can be highly stressful and upsetting. Over many years, 9 out of 10 times when I have to speak/deal with the staff (not doctors) there is generally an issue, such as being giving someone else's prescription attached to yours (twice), sending letters to the wrong hospital, not correctly recording important medical information or providing incorrect information - there are many more but I will limited to a few examples.  

This has been going on for years so these are not just incidents from the stressful last 12 months that everyone is experiencing.

title: COVID webinars
body: The short series of webinars on Covid issues was a great way to disseminate information and to answer patients’ queries and concerns.  Well done

title: Completely frustrating
body: My partner saw his consultant at the hospital and the consultant told him to contact his GP to request a fasting glucose test. I phoned the surgery but the receptionist said that she was unable to arrange a blood test unless the consultant had already completed the WROCS form (request to the lab for a blood test) I asked the receptionist if his own GP or the practice nurse could print off the WROCS form but she said that they were unable to. I’m sorry but I have worked in a GP surgery myself and I know that is untrue. So unless we manage to contact the consultant (who I am sure is far too busy to print off a blood request form) then how on earth is he supposed to have thus blood test done????

title: Fabulous practice with amazing doctors
body: I have been a patient of this practice for many years now and cannot speak highly enough of all of the doctors

title: Poor, uncaring & unprofessional staff
body:
Staff are very unprofessional and advised me to go to UCC even though I had coronavirus symptoms - poor judgment from what seems are untrained reception staff.

Very uncaring frontline staff and management of the practice.

Emergency appointments are only available if you have a very very serious illness.

Receptionist called me to advise I need phased return to work. Surely this should be advised by the actual GP rather than a Receptionist, also to be accompanied with an appropriate Fit Note which I still haven't received!

Very poor service

title: Extremaly unprofessional
body:
Avoid this GP at all cost’s !!! they are extremely unprofessional and neglect their patients.
They can’t follows the simplest instructions when laid out for them in Black and White.
I have been in this country for 5 years and when I arrived I spoke no English, my English is now better than this doctor who is supposed to be looking after us as patients.
I have been ringing them every day to get a fit to fly letter of which I had specifically said what it needs to say, and they charged me for this service when this was only mentioned after the 3rd attempt.
I still to this day have not have not received the correct paper work.

title: Disgrace of a practice
body:
Over the past year I’ve been trying to see my doctor in regards to a knee injury and a back scan done in June 2020. The results for my for my scan still isn’t back 19/02/2021. ( I know ).
As for the knee I’m ether in a cue on the phone for hours ( no joke ) to still not get through, or I’m told to ring in the morning for a emergency appointment which are never available. I’ve even been up to see them while being on the phone to them as caller number 1. I was told it was to busy to answer the phone. ( I was the only 1 in at the time ).
I received a telephone consultation at 4pm as I was in work, the doctor phoned at 10am. 
The practice let’s down the entire community and a stain on the health service, it needs a complete overhaul. This has been happening for years so Covid-19 is no excuse.

title: Great Doctors - Horrific Reception Staff
body:
After having my newborn son, a time when you are most emotionally fragile and vulnerable. I have had to rely on my local GP surgery more than ever before. Each time I have had to contact the Doctor’s surgery I have done so with a sense of trepidation and fear, as each time I have called I have been met with rude and abrupt staff. The treatment is completely unwarranted and I don’t understand why this sort of behaviour has been allowed and tolerated? 
Fortunately the actions of the reception staff don’t reflect the Doctors and the treatment they provide. It may seem trivial and an unjustified complaint to raise, however what if their behaviour led to people being put off from calling and making appointments that they desperately need? This behaviour should not be acceptable and nobody should make you feel scared or anxious especially when you are at your most vulnerable.

title: Disgraceful attitude
body: I am a vulnerable adult and while having taken my wife to the A&E which had 4 people in I was asked or told I couldn't stay in with her because of patients due to covid. I understand this but the fact there is seating for around 20 people I find it offensive how I was spoken to. The fact my wife couldn't walk properly and is my carer. I think it's a disgrace.  I would recommend there staff have training in how to talk to people.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Rude reception staff
body: On many occasions, the attitude from the reception staff I have received has been abrupt and rude. They don’t seem to show empathy, understanding or patience when answering the phones. I appreciate the increased work load they must be under at present but a friendly nature would go a long way. After speaking to other people who are at the surgery, my opinion seems to be quite common. I highly rate the level of service provided by the doctors and nurses but unfortunately, this isn’t reflected consistently in the interactions with the reception staff.

title: Terrible practise
body: I joined the practise in 2017 and everytime I require an appointment I find out that they have deregistered me.  This has happened twice now and as a result can't book appointments.  To top this off have attempted phoning them over the last 3 weeks.  There line is either busy or receive a pre-recorded message saying to phone back when open.... I have been only phoning in operating hours.  For the first time the message changed last week and states you should contact the practise in writing.  We are in the 21st century... i should not have to contact a GP practise in writing with a letter.  Terrible practise.  I would not join if you ever want to see a doctor.

title: Great practice and great staff
body: In the middle of a very dark period in my life with anxiety attacks and suffering health anxiety both the receptionists and GPS have always provided first class support and advice.

title: Excellent
body:
I was an emergency admission for chest pain. From the moment I entered, I was given clear, consistent instructions and information, about what was going to happen, a good time estimation and I observed good vigilance around infection control standards. The young smart Staff nurse with her hair in plaits  who attended to me made an excellent, skilled job of getting a venflon into small veins, and treated me with care and kindness.
 The Dr who saw me was clear in his explanation, kind and extensive in his investigations. I also  heard kindness to other patients, and observed a lot of dedicated work, in what particularly at the moment, during Covid  must be a particularly stressful and demanding time. I am so very thankful to you all for the care I received.

title: Poor service
body:
Been ringing for 2 day's, and always engaged, so how the he'll do you get to see someone,
Its getting worse to get hold of the doctors at this practice,
 Been onto 111 NHS for help now, 
Tenant Street practice is a waste of time.

title: Ignoing goverment advice
body: Stupidly missed covid vacc, breavement in family due to covid. Cant rebook via link, lines closed until monday.  Goverment advixe ring ur gp surgery to book, not this practice you have to wait until monday to book, my friends relatives gp surgery re booked them no problems.

title: Very good experience and hopefully great result.
body: On 07.01.21, my GP referred me to the Lymphoedema Clinic due to a swollen left foot and ankle. I had a telephone consultation on 22.01.21 followed by a face to face consultation on 25.01.21. I was seen by the Lymphoedema Staff Nurse at Little Paxton Surgery and she gave me a thorough examination explaining everything that she was finding with a very clear explanation of the specific treatment I was to receive. Very pleased with everything.

title: Well organised
body: As I entered the car park I was given instructions where to park and then helped across the road to the surgery where I was asking Covid related question. Then shown a short que after being given hand sanitiser after a short time I moved down the line until surprise my own doctor from Baddow surgery  was there ! He actually gave me the injection after asking questions. All completed with ease and excellent organisation. Thank you to all the wonderful people involved 💕

title: Great practice - great covid19 vaccine planning
body:
Great service in booking and administration of covid19 vaccination.
Everything works like clockworks, excellent service and excellent medical care.

title: COVID Vaccine
body:
The only issue was there were to many people in the surgery at the same times around 100 people which in the current lock down conditions  was madness , it was like a cattle market as no one was temperature checked before going inside the surgery. 
  
The staff and volunteers were great and very helpful. But just not happy with the amount of people being in one building

title: Terrible communication
body: Terrible experience at radiology today. Took my mum, who has alzheimer's, to have a chest x-ray though was told by the woman at the radiology front desk that I couldn't wait with her as the waiting area is for patients only. I waited at the cafe area next to radiology instead though instead of taking my mum to me after her x-ray or informing me that she'd had her x-ray they just leave her (and me) for literally half an hour waiting for each other. When a person has dementia they haven't got the capacity to find someone themselves. You'd think people working in a hospital would know this but obviously not. It caused her great distress thinking that I'd left her when I was just waiting in another area on the instruction of the receptionist. They said I couldn't sit with her because of covid safety measures but the end result was me and my mum sitting in a disease ridden hospital for half an hour longer than we needed to be causing greater risk of catching covid. This hospital really is atrocious more often than not.

title: Great service
body: Received COVID vaccine here today. Really well organized with lots of support from pleasant, polite, helpful volunteers and professionals alike. Many thanks to everyone.

title: Poor experience
body: Concerned that an 80 year old patient reporting breathing difficulties and recording extremely high blood pressure ( which has been reported to the practice) has not had a call or telephone consult from their GP . When trying to contact over the last few days the line is ringing a flat tone indicating a telecoms problem. No update offered on the website providing patients with an alternative contact ! Very poor service leaving an elderly patient very anxious. Having read other reviews about this practice I am very concerned about the running of this practice and services offered. A review into management practices will be requested.

title: Difficulty making contact
body: It is very difficult to contact the ward, in this case Gate 43B, by telephone.  Often no one answers.  As an anxious relative this is very distressful.  If contact is eventually made, the staff are generally helpful.

title: Much better than your 'average' practice
body: A very caring and well organised practice. The two Stourport practices have integrated seamlessly and are managing their 'day-to-day' work as well as the additional workload created by Covid with apparent ease.  I am sure they must be paddling hard below the surface but above all seems calm and serene. A sincere well done to all there.

title: Very informative
body: After watching the Facebook live from the practice, I was reassured about the way they have handled the pandemic and the efficient way they are vaccinating their patients

title: Great service
body: Caring staff, very professional. Well done for working so hard in these challenging times. Very good service. 10/10

title: A wast of time
body:
My wife and I have been with surgery for 40 or more years,
They should not call themselves a care service because they DON'T care. 
The surgery has been on steep slide downwards since Dr Trueman left. 
When they do get new Dr's in that are any good they never stay for long. 
They are more interested in stopping meds that you rely on and will tell over the phone that you can't get any more help and suggest you go to church or skip in a field of daffodils and you will not have pain any more.
Look elsware for Dr is my advice.

title: Awful service
body: Booked an appointment of the morning to be told Dr will ring in the afternoon low an behold the surgery is now closed and still no Dr has rang and it's not the first time either

title: Appalling service
body: I had the covid vaccine this week. 12 hrs later I have never felt so ill. The following morning my wife asked if she should contact the surgery. She did so completing the equivalent of the 111 form. She received a text saying she would be contacted later. 4 hrs later she received a text saying they were too busy so I should go to A&E or ring 111. I only wanted a telephone conversation with a doctor or nurse. Absolutely useless which is the way this practise has gone over the last 8 years. I will be going elsewhere as soon as I feel well enough. No one seems to care. It used to be so good.

title: No empathy - very let down
body:
These are very difficult days. Not only are we all concerned about contracting Covid but also having to cope with a seemingly endless lockdown. Being in the fifth cohort my wife and I were very pleased that we would be vaccinated. I received my invitation on Thursday by text, and we both assumed my wife, being just five months younger and approaching her 67th birthday, expected a similar invitation a day or two later. My appointment was made swiftly and efficiently (as was the vaccination process) BUT when my wife received a letter from the NHS - it was not to the surgery but a range of options from Attleborough to Brighton! Not even Norwich! My wife felt very much the second class patient. She raised the issue with surgery. No empathy - just a brush-off. As she was becoming clearly distressed at the thought of having a delay - I went along to the vaccination surgery the day before my appointment and offered my jab to her. The receptionist at Cringleford would not countenance the idea and explained my shot was individually registered to me. Sorry - rot. I was not bothered about having a delay and really could not understand why the substitution could not be done. This was re-enforced  when I had my vaccination.
I acknowledge  that things are not easy, but I would have thought my wife is not alone about being anxious about things and it was such an easy thing to do. I was not seeking a jab myself. The problem was solved by having to book a vaccination at Ipswich - thankfully not Brighton!
With every day we hear in the media about mental well-being, I find it difficult to understand why the receptionist and, indeed, other members of the Humbleyard team did not recognise this as “a cry for help”. We have lived in Swardeston just 18 months and our only visit to the Surgery was to register. We are fortunate that we have not had to seek medical assistance but this lack of care has left us both disillusioned and disappointed.

title: Poor service
body: Extremely difficult to get through to speak to someone. I was 5th in queue and was on hold for 45minutes. When I became 1st in the queue I got cut off!! Every time I phone I have to wait ages to be connected.

title: New Practice Manager
body:
Up until the recent arrival of new practice manager.This surgery was a joke.Rude staff/administration staff were giving advice & instructions as if they were doctors.Prescriptions v rarely on time & more than often incorrect.When challenged wouldn’t admit to fault & blamed other staff.as they refused to give their names when they answered the phone.
New manager has listened to our concerns & acted promptly to sort the staff out .To our delight since our conversation with her we have had 3 weeks problem free .This new practice manager seems to be seriously sorting the incompetent staff out ,at long last

title: Cancelled Appointment
body: Travelled 20 miles to an appointment at Royal Stoke Hospital only to find it had been cancelled.............why do you not inform patients that the appointment had been cancelled you have all the details to do this? And you state that missed appointments cost the NHS £160....What about my time and travelling to cancelled appointment

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Thanks
body:
Hello
My name is David Johnson and I contacted you the other day because I had lost my "sign in" details for online access.
The fault was entirely mine . Unfortunately I have been suffering from Dementia for several years and things are becoming more difficult and this is why I could not easily remember how to reset my account details.
As soon as I explained this, my problem was immediately resolved by one of your staff who instantly provided all that I needed to reset things and re-order my medications.
I quite accept that this is part of the job, but I honestly felt better  - immediately!
I just wanted to say that I truly appreciated the way I was treated and to register my thanks.
Dementia really is an horrendous thing! Human kindness at least helps a bit.
David J.

title: Lack of care
body: Avoid this surgery as doctors will misread hospital results if at all and not pass on important medical information. Trying to book an appointment with rude receptionists is a definite common occurrence. Waiting in the reception area for over 40 minutes is to be expected. Even before the current health pandemic this surgery had many issues. If your relying on a telephone appointment be aware you’ll be waiting all day and possibly not be contacted if at all and have to run the gauntlet of trying to explain how important your test results or symptoms are and then have to explain and justify yourself and your distress to staff receptionists who’s mission it seems is to end the call quicker than a supermarket worker scanning shopping at a local budget supermarket. Excuses such as we’ve had a medical emergency and we’re running behind or the doctor will call you at some point are common and happen more frequently then is acceptable. How a qualified doctor can misdiagnose a serious health condition and fail to read hospital results properly and also not know the procedure for hospital referrals is mystifying. If you value your health and family members health then avoid this surgery. Hopefully divine intervention a decent independent health review of the practice and it’s common practices lack of care irresponsible outcomes will be forthcoming. I know I’m not the first and certainly won’t be the last who has had more than one bad experience at this practice and I hope this honest review will allow others to make an informed choice and better manage their health issues and concerns. The nicest thing about this surgery is the distance of the chairs in the waiting area and the fresh air on the way out of the doors. Also if you have medications don’t use the surgery pharmacist as the lady there seems to enjoy making you wait longer than average and will serve others who arrived after you handed your prescription in and seems to enjoy belittling you if you even try to question mention that you’re being overlooked. However since the local supermarket in the area has better mannered pharmacists my advice would be to use their services regarding medications. I wish I could pretend and detail a more positive feedback on my experiences at this practice but my honesty and the guilt wouldn’t allow me. I hope things improve at this surgery but only an enforceable type action by registered government health organisations would be the most effective in redeeming and restoring the reputation and services that this medical practice needs. Improvements are welcome and overdue alongside retraining.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Just want a smear test
body: 11 weeks so far waiting for a email reply, just want a smear test as never had one. Can't call as you never get an awnser.

title: Fantastic
body:
Cannot recommend this practice enough. Everyone is absolutely fantastic from the reception team to the cleaners. Very caring thoughtful, efficient and respectful. They take time to listen to you and offer help support and guidance. The range of services they offer is brilliant.
I really can't recommend them enough. Keep up the good work and thank you.

title: very fast to help me
body: woke up in middle of night with searing pain under ribcage on right side and felt like a brick was lodged in my throat , took a  hot bath  but pain did not receede. muscle started to spasm  and could not move for pain started vomiting and then muscles spasms came  again  felt like  the end was nigh, partner phoned for ambulance, in ambulance given very strong pain relief , went to a and e, seen . tests done , throat camera done and found  potato chip lodged my throat which had somehow  got stuck..I suffer from Gastro acid reflux  and   somehow a chip  travlled the wrong way after swallowing .very steady hands  of a medic  removed this  and the pain  just dissapeared  and discharged 4 hours later  , what fantastic care ,  taxi home and back to bed , what a night, but what a wonderful workforce, I thought I was going to choke to death all they kept saying was its ok, were' going to fix this, everything will be ok , ..and it was, so thank you  from the bottom of my heart, my partner wasnt allowed to get into the ambulance because of corona and i remember his face, he thought that was the last time he would see me .brilliant service from ambulance to triage, treatment and discharge , thank God for the NHS

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good Practice at vaccinations
body: This Practice could be used as an example of how to vaccinate all patients in a safe and caring manner. They provide an outstanding service. I would recommend their safe vaccination methods to everyone

title: Brilliant practice
body: Perfectly organised for vaccination process today. Prompt calling up for appointments for vaccinations.Friendly faces to make it a pleasant experience. Clear information given. Thank you to everyone involved including many volunteers.

title: Excellent service
body: Attended surgery for Covid vaccination today and was very impressed by the efficient, slick service. Everyone was helpful and polite. Thank you to all involved . You are doing a terrific job.

title: Great team work
body: My COVID vaccination experience could not have been better. Thanks to everyone involved from the car park to the nurse.

title: Fantastic practice, very community focused
body: Brilliant clear, concise, timely communications. Clearly so much time and effort contributed by the entire team, who show empathy, understand and genuine care for their patients.  We are very lucky to have this practice as our chosen provider for our care home setting.

title: Amazing Practice
body: The reception staff at this practice are always so helpful & caring. The GP really listen to your concerns & throughly explain treatment options. Thankyou for all your hardwork this past year.

title: Caring doctors
body: I think Ask My GP is fabulous. It makes getting an appointment so much easier. The doctors are great. They may run a bit late with appointments but that is because they give you the time you need. I never feel rushed at an appointment and the doctor is always keen to get everything sorted so gives the time I need. I couldn’t ask for better care.

title: COVID jab
body: Had my COVID jab at this surgery yesterday. Extremely well organised and very helpful staff. The whole experience took just 10 minutes.

title: Great Practice
body:
I have been registered in this practice for almost 38 years, I have only to praise all at the practice. Doctors, nurses receptionist are all ways happy to help you with a smile.
I would no hesitate to recommend Islip Manor Medical Centre to any one.
Very well done job please keep it up.

title: Good service
body: We went for our COVID vaccine jabs. Excellent service and organisation. The whole process was well organised with good support from local volunteers

title: Covid-19 first jab
body: Vaccine at Salisbury Cathedral. In and out in about 5 mins. Very coordinated, caring and professional. Soothing organ music. I must be pretty sad as I think this was the highlight of my day.

title: Excellent practice
body:
I was hugely impressed by the drive in covid vaccination centre at estuary view.
A magnificent endeavour by all concerned, seamless and speedy administration by polite and courteous staff.
I’ve lived in Whitstable for approx 35 years and been treated at all three surgeries in that time.
At all times I received superb treatment by various doctors and been treated with respect and politeness from all the the staff both doctors, nurses and receptionists.
The practice is now under extreme pressure dealing with the present covid crisis but the standard of exemplary treatment has not deteriorated at all.
Obviously face to face contact is restricted and there exists online diagnostic tool to use that the doctors have access to. If ones problem cannot be resolved at this stage one will be contacted by the surgery.
I unfortunately have terminal cancer and had an unexplained rash appear. The problem was difficult to explain online. I was contacted by a doctor at the Health centre within a matter of hours who thought it might have been Shingles and a face to face consultation was arranged, fortunately for me it wasn’t Shingles, If it had been it would have been very dangerous for me with my much reduced immune system.
I mentioned this to emphasise how meticulous the practice is.
I’ve had several telephone consultations with doctors about matter relating to my cancer also other conditions I also have. 
In all the years I’ve lived in Whitstable and had 4 young children in the early days the standards of this practice have never diminished.

title: Wonderful Practice
body: It’s the consistently  brilliant service this practice provides that has prompted me to leave a review. The reception team in particular are always so incredibly efficient, friendly and professional. Each Doctor I have seen has been thorough. I am very grateful to be a patient at this practice and wish to say thank you to the team there

title: Covid Vaccination
body: Very efficient, I was in and out within 5 minutes of arriving. Excellent set up, well done to everyone at the Centre.

title: Caring, totally professional GP.
body: I felt really unwell last weekend so I sent an email to my GP who responded first thing Monday morning. He prescribed medication which rapidly cleared the infection he diagnosed. He followed up as promised with a phone call on Friday morning, at that time he placed me on a background medication to prevent future infections and also ordered a precautionary blood test.  My family and I have been with this practice for forty years and have always received the very best of care and support from the whole team.

title: Very efficient
body: I received my Covid19 vaccination with great care and efficiency from staff and volunteers at Whitley House. The whole process only took 10 minutes. Impressive!!

title: Positive covid vaccination visit
body: Attended last night, 19th Feb, for my 1st covid jab. Very efficient,  well run, slick operation. Lots of helpers on hand to guide me through every step of the way. Never felt lost or unsure as to what I should do. The jab experience itself was excellent,  the doctor explained everything then jabbed me and I didn't feel a thing. In and out within 5 minutes. Well done to all the doctors, nurses, staff and volunteers.

title: Look After Yourself!
body:
I went for my 3 yearly Breast Screen as usual and I'm glad I did.  The mammograms showed changes, which have since been diagnosed as Breast Cancer for which I will be having surgery and further treatment. Once completed, I can get back to living life as normal. If I'd not had my Screening, the Cancer could possibly have spread to other parts of my body, making things much more complicated.

The actual mammograms take minutes. Make some time and look after yourself.

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Great service
body: I had my first Covid 19 jab at the surgery on 19/2/2021. I found the service provided was excellent.    Everyone was so helpful and thoughtful. 10 out of 10

title: Amazing organisation
body: I had my coronavirus vaccine at this practice. The organisation was absolutely superb! Well done to everyone concerned.

title: Helpful and friendly
body: The staff who answer the phones are always so friendly and helpful. I can’t imagine the past year has been easy for them but whenever i call and whoever I speak to, they are always caring and understanding. I recently called after my daughter was discharged from hospital with a medication change however unfortunately the surgery had not received her discharge letter. I was able to email a copy and the lady got it to the GP who issued the prescription the next day. The service we receive is always outstanding. Thank you all.

title: Superheroes
body: Had my 1st COVID vaccination. Got called at 09:30 & had it done by 10:15. Staff were exceptional. Most important it was on my birthday & they all sung happy birthday to me. Fantastic staff, clear explanations & I have the utmost respect for everyone who is helping us all work back to normality. Thank You NHS

title: Covid19 Vaccination
body:
Very well organised and efficient.  Explained what was happening.  In and out in less than 10 minutes
Thanks to everyone involved

title: Excellent experience with COVID vaccine
body:
My family was recently invited to have the COVID vaccine. We each received an SMS with a personalised link for booking, which was simple and clear. Slots were available the same week. We also received SMS reminders the day before.

On the day things went really well: queing, communications, flow management, the vaccine itself. The location was well chosen and protection measures were adhered to. We are very grateful to all staff at our surgery and wish the best of luck during these difficult times.

title: Great Dr
body: Made me feel very comfortable and was very reassuring throughout. Was nervous about it but made me feel as ease and was a lovely person.

title: COVID-19 Vaccination
body:
The whole process from receiving my notification, to booking an appointment and then receiving my jab went like clockwork. 

At the GP surgery the voluntary and medical staff were polite, courteous and professional at all times. A very slick and well organised service. Thank you

title: COVID-19 vaccination : quick service, efficient…
body: Lane End isn't my normal surgery but have just had my COVID-19 vaccination there.  What was particularly impressive was how well organised the whole operation was - lots of staff (many volunteers I expect), all working efficiently together, all friendly and professional. As you'd expect all the necessary controls were in place, like use of face masks, distanced seating, hand sanitizer etc.  Which all made for a quick turnaround, and a very positive experience.

title: Amazing service by everyone
body: Just had my 1st coronavirus vaccination.  What an excellent system at the surgery.  Very safe, efficient and quick.  Grateful thanks to all the staff and volunteers - you are all doing an amazing job.

title: Covid Vaccination
body:
Very clear
Very clean
Very pleasant

Proffesionally managed with calm clear directions and self evident method.

title: COVID vaccination
body: Excellent service, extremely well organised. In and out in less than 5 minutes and earlier than my time slot. Well done!!

title: Wonderful people
body:
I and my family have been patients at this surgery (formerly Green St. Clinic) for over 44 years. We have always had good care.
I have chronic health problems and my husband has recently developed serious health issues.

We have both been well looked after.  Despite the pandemic, all the staff have continued to attend to our needs.  We have both been seen in the surgery a number of times in the past year and every time have been impressed with the COVID measures in place. It has always felt SAFE.

We have had phone consultations and have sent in photos when requested, usually followed up with a face to face meeting with our great GP.  We never feel rushed, although we know they must be really busy.  We have met all of the GPs over the years and every one of them has been excellent.

The nurses have also been extremely helpful and supportive and the person who takes blood (she will know who she is) is so good at it that I hardly feel a scratch. (I have had blood taken many times at the hospital and know that this is a real skill as my vein doesn't always co-operate!).

The reception and admin staff have been very helpful in answering queries about prescriptions, sorting out appointments and doing their utmost to make sure that things are ok for us. 

I am sure everyone at the VMC is under tremendous pressure but they don't let it show.

The only downside is the building itself as this is no longer suitable but with the new clinic building well under way this will soon be resolved.  At the moment, some of the GPs have surgeries upstairs (no lift) but they are always willing to use a room downstairs to see you if you let them know when making the appointment. 

The VMC is entering a new era, merging with other local practices and subsequently moving to a brand new building. There will no doubt be some disruption and some teething troubles at first but I have no doubt that everyone's first consideration will be to keep everything running as smoothly as possible for their patients.

My husband and I thank them all for everything they do for us.

title: Coronavirus vaccine
body: Had my vaccine yesterday at this surgery. The whole set up from parking to completion was excellent and only took 15 mins. Congrats and thank you to everyone there.
